summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to JetBlue Airways Corporation, dated January 23, 2020. It commands JetBlue to produce records related to Ghislaine Maxwell for specific time periods (1994-1998 and July 2019 onward) and to appear before the grand jury on February 7, 2020. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of grand jury subpoena for records
persons.context: The subpoena requests all records from JetBlue Airways for Ghislaine Maxwell, also known as Ghislaine Borgerson, for the periods January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019 through the date of service.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance for JetBlue
events.description: JetBlue Airways Corporation is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York at the United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, at 10 a.m. to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal criminal law.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to JetBlue
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to JetBlue Airways Corporation, requesting records for Ghislaine Maxwell and setting an appearance date.

locations: Silvio J. Atollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
JetBlue Airways Corporation, 2701 Queens Plaza N., Suite 1, Long Island City, NY 11101
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to JetBlue Airways on January 23, 2020, as part of an official criminal investigation of a suspected felony.

The subpoena specifically seeks all records related to Ghislaine Maxwell (a/k/a Ghislaine Borgerson, DOB 12/25/1961) for two time periods: January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019 through the date of service.
The Government requested that JetBlue voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena commands JetBlue to appear before the Grand Jury on February 7, 2020, at 10 a.m. at the U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, in Manhattan.

The alleged violations under investigation include federal criminal statutes: 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 1594(c), 2422(b), and 371, which relate to sex trafficking, conspiracy to commit sex trafficking, coercion and enticement, and conspiracy.
